revised_title: Stability of Viscous Flow Between Rotating Cylinders: A New Asymptotic Expansion Approach
tldr: The authors present an asymptotic expansion approach to study the stability of viscous flow between rotating cylinders. They find that for a fixed value of the critical angular speed, there is only a limited number of possible wavelengths, which leads to the conclusion that the motion becomes turbulent for large values of the parameter. The solution confirms previous theoretical conclusions and shows a complete agreement with numerical results.
